intro: Leucas javanica f. montana, commonly known as the mountain leucas, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically pale blue to violet, arranged in whorls along the stems, and bloom during the warmer months. This variety is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
